Link is in my sig. Needs stretchy tanks and procedural fairings but included in the download is a stock lander and CM to put on top of your own lifter if you want to stay stock.

I`m working on KerPollo 7 which has a better lander and the lifter looks more like how it should. Might be nearer christmas when I release it though. Bit busy lately.

I recently did my first Mun and return mission. No rover but here it is anyway. I like posting screenshots. I could always stick a docking port on the bottom of the poodle I suppose...

My little one man Apollo style lander.

wow cool that small lander has way more fuel than my smallest 2 staged landers it seems to be very fuel efficient download link please to test

great job scarecrow88

My latest version no longer has the comms antenna or any scientific instruments, but apart from that is unchanged. I'll see if I can separate it from the launch vehicle in the VAB and save it as a sub-assembly for you.

ETA: Here it is Eagle Lander craft

As said above, the entire lander has enough fuel to land and return to orbit. I usually have my command module at about 25000m orbit. If launching just the ascent stage, the decoupler and ascent engine should be in the same stage to decouple and fire at the same time. I usually start at about 2/3 throttle as it doesn't take much being so small. Before throttling up prior to staging, remember to deactivate the lander engine. The ascent stage doesn't have a lot of fuel, but as long as you are not wasteful, you have enough to return to orbit (25k) and rendezvous with a command module. It isn't fitted with RCS, so I do final manoeuvring for docking using the command module.

Have fun.

Edited November 28, 2013 by Scarecrow88

My latest version no longer has the comms antenna or any scientific instruments, but apart from that is unchanged. I'll see if I can separate it from the launch vehicle in the VAB and save it as a sub-assembly for you.

ETA: Here it is Eagle Lander craft

As said above, the entire lander has enough fuel to land and return to orbit. I usually have my command module at about 25000m orbit. If launching just the ascent stage, the decoupler and ascent engine should be in the same stage to decouple and fire at the same time. I usually start at about 2/3 throttle as it doesn't take much being so small. Before throttling up prior to staging, remember to deactivate the lander engine. The ascent stage doesn't have a lot of fuel, but as long as you are not wasteful, you have enough to return to orbit (25k) and rendezvous with a command module. It isn't fitted with RCS, so I do final manoeuvring for docking using the command module.

Have fun.

I`ve adapted your lander concept and made an escape pod using the one man can, 4 legs a few donuts and a small engine. I plan on fitting them to use as microdropships to add crew to bases n stuff. It`s pretty much your ascent stage with legs and either 1000Dv or 3700Dv (with droptanks for Tylo et al). The larger version with drop tanks can land on Duna and then return back to Kerbin...
